subclassFeature.name: Lucky Day
entries: After a long rest, you toss a coin (roll {@dice d2}) to determine your fortune for the day.

rows: the DM can impose disadvantage on one roll of their choice before your next long rest
you gain advantage on one roll of your choice

entries: This feature cannot be manipulated or rerolled.

rows: {@spell color spray}, {@spell disguise self}, {@spell fog cloud}

subclassFeature.name: Card Infusion
entries: When casting a spell that creates projectiles (like {@spell magic missile}) or creates an environmental effect (like {@spell grease}) you can choose to infuse the projectile(s) into a cards.
When you cast it as a card you get the following benefits:

items: This action does not requires verbal or somatic components (though the spell cannot be cast when Silenced, already created cards can be thrown).
Enemies cannot recognize the spell you cast unless they have {@sense Truesight}.

This cast counts as a {@bold ranged spell attack}. The range of the attack is the same as the spell's range. On impact the spell returns normal and all hit requirements must be concluded by the spells original behaviour.
Enemies hit the {@bold first time} have {@bold disadvantage} on saving throws against the spell. Entities with Int<7 cannot be affected by this, because they cannot distinguish any attack anyway.
Casting a spell this way while in stealth gives you advantage on the saving throw against being revealed.

entries: You can use this feature up to the {@bold number of times equal to your sorcerer level} per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Trick Deck
entries: Whenever you create an infused card you can create {@bold one} of the following effects:

items: {@bold Illusory Cards}: You create {@bold fake card} up to the number of your sorcerer level. You can throw these card the same way as the original spell. On impact you may create an illusion with rules as in {@spell minor illusion}. These have no effect other than visual distraction.

{@bold Withholding Spells}: You hold the cards up to {@bold one minute} and as a {@bold bonus action} throw up to a number of them equal to your {@bold DEX mod}. You cannot use this feature while an another one is active.
{@bold Bend Path}: You bend the cards path making it {@bold ignore half and three-quarter covers}.

{@bold Delayed Expansion}: You choose to not detonate the card immediately on impact and make it {@bold linger up to one minute}. You can use a {@bold bonus action} to detonate it. Enemies destroying the card detonate it automatically.
{@bold Metamagic Infusion}: You affect the spell with one {@classFeature Metamagic|Sorcerer||3} option you know.

entries: You can use this feature up to the {@bold number of times equal to your sorcerer level} per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Trickery
entries: You can use up to 2 Trick Deck options per cast.
You gain the following Trick Deck option:

items: {@bold Arcane Gambit}: As an action you can infuse spell with cast time of {@bold reaction} (such as {@spell shield} or {@spell counterspell}) into a card and hold it up to one minute. When you use this card as a reaction, you cast the spell with advantage on any required rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Quick Hands
entries: You gain the following Trick Deck improvements:

items: {@bold Bend Path}: The spell's range is increased by 30 feet, ignores full covers and doesn't impose disadvantage on short ranges.

{@bold Delayed Expansion}: By making a {@skill Sleight of Hand} check against opponents' Passive Perception ({@skill Perception}) can make them unaware of the Delayed Card. The card can also linger up to 30 minutes.
{@bold Metamagic Infusion}: You affect the spell with up to {@bold two} metamagic options.

subclassFeature.name: Ultimate Trickery
entries: You can use up to 3 Trick Deck options per cast.

You choose a level 3 or lower spell that can be cast with {@bold Card Infusion} and make it your {@bold Signature Card}. A signature card can be cast without expanding a spell slot or consuming uses of Card Infusion.
